books.title: The Shining
books.author: Stephen King
books.description: A family heads to an isolated hotel for the winter where an evil spiritual presence influences the father into violence.

books.title: It
books.author: Stephen King
books.description: In the town of Derry, the local kids are disappearing one by one, leaving behind bloody remains.

books.title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
books.author: J.K. Rowling
books.description: A young boy discovers he is a wizard on his 11th birthday.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit, is recruited by a wizard and a group of dwarves to reclaim their mountain home from a dragon.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: A young girl grows up in a racially charged town in the Deep South.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society under constant surveillance.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: A classic romantic novel about the manners and matrimonial machinations among the British gentry of the early 19th century.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: A story about the events and circumstances that lead to the mental breakdown of a young boy.

books.title: Moby-Dick
books.author: Herman Melville
books.description: The narrative of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to kill the white whale, Moby Dick.

books.title: War and Peace
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.description: A depiction of Russian society during the Napoleonic Era.

books.title: Charlotte's Web
books.author: E.B. White
books.description: A story about the friendship between a pig named Wilbur and a spider named Charlotte.

books.title: The Very Hungry Caterpillar
books.author: Eric Carle
books.description: A caterpillar eats its way through a wide variety of foodstuffs before pupating and emerging as a butterfly.

books.title: Green Eggs and Ham
books.author: Dr. Seuss
books.description: A story about a character named Sam-I-Am who tries to convince another character to eat green eggs and ham.

books.title: Goodnight Moon
books.author: Margaret Wise Brown
books.description: A classic children's book about a bunny saying goodnight to everything around.

books.title: Where the Wild Things Are
books.author: Maurice Sendak
books.description: A story about a young boy named Max who goes on an adventure to where the wild things are.

books.title: The Da Vinci Code
books.author: Dan Brown
books.description: A mystery thriller novel that involves the symbologist Robert Langdon.

books.title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
books.author: Stieg Larsson
books.description: A mystery novel featuring a journalist and a hacker.

books.title: Gone Girl
books.author: Gillian Flynn
books.description: A thriller novel about the mysterious disappearance of a woman named Amy Dunne.

books.title: Fifty Shades of Grey
books.author: E.L. James
books.description: A romance novel that features a deep relationship between a college graduate and a young business magnate.

books.title: The Fault in Our Stars
books.author: John Green
books.description: A love story about two teenage cancer patients.

books.title: The Road
books.author: Cormac McCarthy
books.description: A post-apocalyptic novel about a father and his young son.

books.title: The Book Thief
books.author: Markus Zusak
books.description: A story about a young girl living in Nazi Germany who steals books.

books.title: The Alchemist
books.author: Paulo Coelho
books.description: A novel about a young Andalusian shepherd in his journey to the pyramids of Egypt.

books.title: Life of Pi
books.author: Yann Martel
books.description: A story about a young man who survives a shipwreck and is stranded on a lifeboat with a Bengal tiger.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: A story about the young and mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his obsession with the beautiful former debutante Daisy Buchanan.

books.title: Jane Eyre
books.author: Charlotte Brontë
books.description: A novel about the experiences of its eponymous heroine, including her growth to adulthood and her love for Mr. Rochester.

books.title: Wuthering Heights
books.author: Emily Brontë
books.description: A story about the turbulent and unrequited love between Heathcliff and Catherine Earnshaw.

books.title: The Hunger Games
books.author: Suzanne Collins
books.description: A dystopian novel about a televised fight to the death in a future society.

books.title: Catching Fire
books.author: Suzanne Collins
books.description: The second book in The Hunger Games series.

books.title: Mockingjay
books.author: Suzanne Collins
books.description: The third book in The Hunger Games series.

books.title: Twilight
books.author: Stephenie Meyer
books.description: A romance novel about a teenage girl and a vampire.

books.title: New Moon
books.author: Stephenie Meyer
books.description: The second book in the Twilight series.

books.title: Eclipse
books.author: Stephenie Meyer
books.description: The third book in the Twilight series.

books.title: Breaking Dawn
books.author: Stephenie Meyer
books.description: The fourth book in the Twilight series.

books.title: The Maze Runner
books.author: James Dashner
books.description: A young adult dystopian science fiction novel about a group of teenagers trapped in a maze.

books.title: The Lord of the Rings
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: An epic high-fantasy novel set in the fictional world of Middle-earth.

books.title: Dune
books.author: Frank Herbert
books.description: A science fiction novel about the son of a noble family entrusted with the protection of the most valuable asset and most vital element in the galaxy.

books.title: Ender's Game
books.author: Orson Scott Card
books.description: A military science fiction novel about a young boy recruited to save humanity from an alien threat.

books.title: The Chronicles of Narnia
books.author: C.S. Lewis
books.description: A series of seven fantasy novels set in the fictional realm of Narnia.

books.title: The Golden Compass
books.author: Philip Pullman
books.description: A fantasy novel about a young girl's adventure in a parallel universe.

books.title: The Martian
books.author: Andy Weir
books.description: A science fiction novel about an astronaut stranded on Mars.

books.title: Ready Player One
books.author: Ernest Cline
books.description: A dystopian science fiction novel about a virtual reality treasure hunt.

books.title: A Game of Thrones
books.author: George R.R. Martin
books.description: A fantasy novel about the political and social upheaval in the fictional land of Westeros.

books.title: The Handmaid's Tale
books.author: Margaret Atwood
books.description: A dystopian novel about a theocratic society in which women are property of the state.

books.title: The Kite Runner
books.author: Khaled Hosseini
books.description: A novel about friendship and redemption set against the backdrop of a changing Afghanistan.

books.title: Slaughterhouse-Five
books.author: Kurt Vonnegut
books.description: A science fiction-infused anti-war novel about the World War II experiences of Billy Pilgrim.

books.title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
books.author: Douglas Adams
books.description: A comic science fiction series about the adventures of Arthur Dent, an unwitting human who is swept off Earth just before it's destroyed.

books.title: Frankenstein
books.author: Mary Shelley
books.description: A novel about a young scientist who creates a grotesque creature in an unorthodox scientific experiment.

books.title: Dracula
books.author: Bram Stoker
books.description: A novel about Count Dracula's attempt to move from Transylvania to England.

books.title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.description: A novel about a young man who remains eternally youthful while his portrait ages.

favorites.author: J.K. Rowling
